text.title: Safely Eat a Carolina Reaper Pepper

head.s: Safely Eat a Carolina Reaper Pepper

p.s: Pepper is the world ’s spiciest pepper at 1.5 million Scoville Units .
Due to this notorious distinction , many individuals on YouTube and other social media formats have taken on the “ Carolina Reaper Pepper Challenge ” in which they attempt to consume this pepper .

Although such efforts are carried out with the purpose of entertainment , serious precautions need to be taken into consideration in order to ensure safety for the person eating a Carolina Reaper Pepper and surrounding people .

head.s: Gauging Your Ability to Eat Spicy Food

item.s: Consume a serving of a spicy snack food .
Any irritation in your mouth , stomach , or eyes in response to consumption of these items is a likely indication of low spice tolerance and signal to avoid eating a Carolina Reaper Pepper .
Eat a serving of a spicier item such as a jalapenos if the item from step 1 was consumed comfortably .
If these spicier items can be comfortably consumed , it is likely safe to proceed with eating a Carolina Reaper Pepper under the right precautions .
If discomfort is experienced , chew on a slice of bread to remove spicy chemicals from taste buds .
Eat a serving of an even spicier item such as cayenne pepper if Step 2 was consumed comfortably .
If discomfort is experienced , drink milk to remove the heat .
Purchase the Carolina Reaper Pepper from an online store , as it is often not sold in grocery stores .
Online stores like PuckerButt Pepper Company and Amazon are reliable options , as they provide packaging costing $ 1 - 2 per Carolina Reaper Pepper .
Buy a gallon of milk , antacids , and towel from a local grocery store if necessary .
The milk and antacids help deal with the discomfort of consuming the pepper while the towel help to clean up a potential mess .

figure.rend: Transition a Baby to Cow's Milk Step 3.jpg

item.s: Have a light meal prior to consuming the pepper .
Such a precaution significantly decreases the likelihood of throwing up food that is being digested .
A slow-digesting item like meat or oatmeal is recommended .

figure.rend: Do the Oatmeal Diet Step 4 Version 3.jpg

item.s: Mentally calm down before eating the pepper .
Stress has been shown to worsen an individual 's response to spicy foods .
Eat only one pepper at a time , not multiple .
Consuming more than one pepper greatly increases the potential for body irritation and health danger .

figure.rend: Cool Burns from Chili Peppers Step 14.jpg

item.s: Avoid making tongue contact with the seeds and inner pepper , instead mainly contacting the outer flesh of the pepper .
The seeds and associated inner flesh contain the highest capsaicin content , making them the spiciest portion of the pepper as capsaicin is the component that gives a spicy flavor .
Thoroughly chew the pepper .
Swallowing prematurely without fully breaking the pepper down greatly increases the risk of stomach discomfort .
Slowly drink milk if any irritation is felt in the mouth area .
Milk contains casein that binds to capsaicin , neutralizing its spicy effect .

figure.rend: Cool Burns from Chili Peppers Step 1 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Consume antacids if any stomach pain is felt more than an hour after pepper consumption .
Antacids will help to reduce feelings of heartburn and other stomach discomforts .
Receive medical attention if stomach pain is felt more than an hour after pepper consumption .
Such a prolonged body response necessitates medical treatment .

figure.rend: Create a Home First Aid Kit Step 1 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Wash your hands .
Capsaicin residue can remain on fingers after pepper consumption and can lead to skin irritation in certain areas for the person who consumed the pepper and other individuals .

figure.rend: Remove Paint from Skin Step 1 Version 3.jpg

item.s: Use a rag to clean the table or other areas that the pepper has touched .
Such areas can contain capsaicin residue and be harmful to those individuals who come into contact with them .
